metadata.title: CVE-2022-42895 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
There is an infoleak vulnerability in the Linux kernel'snet/bluetooth/l2cap_core.c's l2cap_parse_conf_req function which can beused to leak kernel pointers remotely. We recommend upgrading past commithttps://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/b1a2cd50c0357f243b7435a732b4e62ba3157a2ehttps://www.google.com/url

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42895` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-237-generic - 4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-237-generic - 4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-237-lowlatency - 4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1116-aws - 4.4.0-1116.122
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-237.271~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1116.122').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1').
